resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: YEAR
resources.schema.fields.description: Year of crash. (e.g., 2019)

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: MONTH
resources.schema.fields.description: Month of crash. (e.g. JANUARY)

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACC_DAY_OF_WEEK
resources.schema.fields.description: Day of week of crash. (e.g., Thursday)

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_TIME
resources.schema.fields.description: Actual time of crash in military format (24-hour clock).  (e.g., 1645)

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: TIME_CATEGORY
resources.schema.fields.description: Time of crash in three-hour groupings (e.g., 15:00-17:59)

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_LOCATION
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes location where accident occurred. Intersections include junctions of intersecting highways.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_LOCATION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes location where accident occurred. Intersections include junctions of intersecting highways.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_TYPE
resources.schema.fields.description:
The numeric code that describes the severity of the crash and is hierarchical according to the following order:
• Fatal accident - A crash that resulted in fatal injuries to one or more persons, with death occurring within 30 days of the accident.
• Bodily Injury - A crash resulting in an injury with no fatalities.
• Property Damage Only - Crash incident resulting in material damages to property (vehicle or non-vehicle, such as structures) with no injuries or fatalities.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_TYPE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description:
The text description that describes the severity of the crash and is hierarchical according to the following order:
• Fatal accident - A crash that resulted in fatal injuries to one or more persons, with death occurring within 30 days of the accident.
• Bodily Injury - A crash resulting in an injury with no fatalities.
• Property Damage Only - Crash incident resulting in material damages to property (vehicle or non-vehicle, such as structures) with no injuries or fatalities.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ATTEND_CODE
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that identifies if an investigation made at scene, vehicle not removed from scene.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ATTEND_DESC
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that identifies if an investigation made at scene, vehicle not removed from scene.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: CITY_NAME
resources.schema.fields.description: The municipality in which the crash occurred. (e.g., VANCOUVER)

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: REGION
resources.schema.fields.description: The ICBC region in B.C. in which the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: STREET_DIRECTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The optional prefix or suffix used to identify roads or road infrastructure components divided by compass direction, usually for block numbering.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: STREET_TYPE
resources.schema.fields.description: The type of street, thoroughfare or road infrastructure component where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: CROSS_STREET_DIRECTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The optional prefix or suffix used to identify roads or road infrastructure components divided by compass direction, usually for purpose of block numbering. The direction of this attribute applies to the closest crossroad where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: CROSS_STREET_TYPE
resources.schema.fields.description: The type of the nearest cross-street, thoroughfare or road infrastructure component where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: DIAGRAM
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the primary crash occurrence.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: DIAGRAM_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the primary crash occurrence.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: HIGHWAY_LOCATION
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the road type on which the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LOC_HIGHWAY_DESC
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the road type on which the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: HIT_AND_RUN_INDICATOR
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that identifies whether a party involved in the crash failed to stop at scene.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: HIT_AND_RUN_INDICATOR_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that identifies whether a party involved in the crash failed to stop at scene.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LAND_USE
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the land use character of the location where the accident occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LAND_USE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the land use character of the location where the accident occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LIGHT
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the lighting condition at the time of the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LIGHT_SHORT_DESCRIPTION

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LOCATION_1_EVENT
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the lighting condition at the time of the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LOCATION_1_EVENT_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the lighting condition at the time of the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ON_ROAD_FLAG
resources.schema.fields.description: Identifies if the crash occurred on a roadway.

resources.schema.fields.name: PARKING_LOT_FLAG

resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that identifies the pedestrian’s action immediately prior to being struck, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: PEDESTRIAN_ACTIVITY_SHORT_DESCRIPTION

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: PEDESTRIAN_LOCATION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that identifies the location of a pedestrian when struck, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: PLACE
resources.schema.fields.description: The municipality in which the crash occurred. (e.g., VANCOUVER)

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: POLICE_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description of the police detachment associated with the site of the accident.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: POLICE_ZONE
resources.schema.fields.description: Describes the regional zone within a police detachment's jurisdiction.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ROAD_CHARACTER_SHORT_DESCRIPTION

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT

resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes structure of roadway on which accident occurred. Parking lots are coded as 98 (Not Applicable.).

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ROAD_CLASS_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes structure of roadway on which accident occurred. Parking lots are coded as 98 (Not Applicable).

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ROAD_CONDITION
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the roadway surface where the crash occurred.

resources.schema.fields.name: ROAD_CONDITION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT

resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the type of road surface where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ROAD_SURFACE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT

resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the traffic control at the scene of the crash.

resources.schema.fields.name: TRAFFIC_CONTROL_SHORT_DESCRIPTION

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: TRAFFIC_FLOW_CODE_LABEL

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: TYPE_COLLISION_2
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes that second type of accident collision event after the primary occurrence (diagram).

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: TYPE_COLLISION_2_SHORT_DESCRIPTION

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ALCOHOL_INVOLVED
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
10 - Alcohol Involvement
80 - Ability Impaired by Alcohol
81 - Alcohol Suspected

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: DRUG_INVOLVED
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
15 - Drugs (Illegal)
27 - Prescribed Medication
82 - Ability Impaired by Drugs
83 - Drugs Suspected
84 - Ability Impaired by Medication

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: IMPAIRED_INVOLVED
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
10 - Alcohol Involvement
15 - Drugs (Illegal)
27 - Prescribed Medication
80 - Ability Impaired by Alcohol
81 - Alcohol Suspected
82 - Ability Impaired by Drugs
83 - Drugs Suspected
84 - Ability Impaired by Medication

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: SPEED_INVOLVED
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
31 - Unsafe Speed (retired in 2004)
35 - Exceeding Speed Limit
36 - Excessive Speed over 40 km/h
37 - Driving Too Fast for Conditions

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: EXCEEDING_SPEED

Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
35 - Exceeding Speed Limit

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: EXCESSIVE_SPEED
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
36 - Excessive Speed over 40 km/h

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: DRIVING_TOO_FAST

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: FELL_ASLEEP
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
19 - Fell Asleep

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: DISTRACTED_INVOLVED
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
34 - Use of Communication/Video Equipment
85 - Driver Inattentive
86 - Driver Internal/External Distraction

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: DRIVER_INATTENTIVE
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
85 - Driver Inattentive

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: DRIVER_INT_EXT_DISTRACTION
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
86 - Driver Internal/External Distraction

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: COMMUNICATION_VIDEO_EQUIPMENT

34 - Use of Communication/Video Equipment

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: DRIVING_WITHOUT_DUE_CARE
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
13 - Driving Without Due Care

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: HIGH_RISK_DRIVING
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
18 - Failing To Yield Right Of Way
20 - Following Too Closely
21 - Improper Passing
29 - Ignoring Traffic Control Device
31 - Unsafe Speed
35 - Exceeding Speed Limit
36 - Excessive Speed over0 km/h
37 - Driving Too Fast for Conditions

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ANIMAL_FLAG
resources.schema.fields.description:
Identifies if the crash involved one or more entities with the following contributing factors:
70 - Domestic Animal
71 - Wild Animal

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CHARGES_1
resources.schema.fields.description: The alphabetic letter of the Act and the section number that describes the first of a maximum of three charges laid against the entity involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: BLOOD_ALCOHOL_CONTENT
resources.schema.fields.description: The Blood Alcohol Concentration (BAC) of the driver involved in the crash tested and analyzed from the breath or blood sample. BAC is measured in milligrams of alcohol per millilitres of blood.  For example, a reading of 80 is 80 milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CHARGES_1_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the Act of the first of a maximum of three charges laid against the entity.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CHARGES_2
resources.schema.fields.description: The alphabetic letter of the Act and the section number that describes the second of a maximum of three charges laid against the entity involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CHARGES_2_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the Act of the second of a maximum of three charges laid against the entity.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CHARGES_3
resources.schema.fields.description: The alphabetic letter of the Act and the section number that describes the third of a maximum of three charges laid against the entity involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CHARGES_3_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the Act of the second of a maximum of three charges laid against the entity.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CONTRIBUTING_FACTOR_1
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the circumstances or events that the attending police officer perceives to directly contribute to a traffic collision. Up to four different contributing factors per entity are recorded.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY

resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the circumstances or events that the attending police officer perceives to directly contribute to a traffic collision. Up to four different contributing factors per entity are recorded.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CONTRIBUTING_FACTOR_2
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the circumstances or events that the attending police officer perceives to directly contribute to a traffic collision. Up to four different contributing factors per entity are recorded.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CONTRIBUTING_FACTOR_2_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the circumstances or events that the attending police officer perceives to directly contribute to a traffic collision. Up to four different contributing factors per entity are recorded.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CONTRIBUTING_FACTOR_3
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the circumstances or events that the attending police officer perceives to directly contribute to a traffic collision. Up to four different contributing factors per entity are recorded.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CONTRIBUTING_FACTOR_3_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the circumstances or events that the attending police officer perceives to directly contribute to a traffic collision. Up to four different contributing factors per entity are recorded.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CONTRIBUTING_FACTOR_4
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the circumstances or events that the attending police officer perceives to directly contribute to a traffic collision. Up to four different contributing factors per entity are recorded.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: CONTRIBUTING_FACTOR_4_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the circumstances or events that the attending police officer perceives to directly contribute to a traffic collision. Up to four different contributing factors per entity are recorded.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: DAMAGE_LOCATION
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric identifier that identifies the location of damage on a vehicle, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: DAMAGE_LOCATION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that identifies the location of damage on a vehicle, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: DAMAGE_SEVERITY
resources.schema.fields.description: A numeric code that describes the estimated level of damage as visible at the time of the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: DAMAGE_SEVERITY_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: A text description that describes the estimated level of damage as visible at the time of the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: DRIVER_LICENSE_JURISDICTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The abbreviated description of the originating jurisdiction for a driver’s licence.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: DRIVER_LICENSE_JURISDICTION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description of the originating jurisdiction for a driver’s licence.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: ENTITY_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: The classification assigned to an entity used to categorize the type of entity.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: ENTITY_NUMBER_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the entity type in a crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: ENTITY_TYPE
resources.schema.fields.description: Vehicle, pedestrian, cyclist, or ‘other road vehicle’ involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: ENTITY_TYPE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: Vehicle, pedestrian, cyclist, or ‘other road vehicle’ involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY

resources.schema.fields.description: The alphabetic letter that describes gender of the entity involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: GENDER_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the gender of the entity involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY

resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric class of the B.C. learner driver’s licence number for a driver in the crash, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: LEARNER_CLASS_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the B.C. class of the learner driver’s licence number for a driver in the crash, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: LICENSE_CLASS
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric class of the driver’s licence number for a driver in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: LICENSE_CLASS_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the class of the driver’s licence number for a driver in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: LICENSE_INDICATOR
resources.schema.fields.description: The alphabetic letter that indicates novice or new learner of the Licence Class, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: LICENSE_INDICATOR_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that indicates novice or new learner of the Licence Class, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: POSSIBLE_OFFENDER_INDICATOR
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that identifies whether the entity was at fault base on the attending police officer will assessment of the crash. This indicator indicates the officer’s decision, regardless of the ensuing legal and/or insurance results.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: OFFENDER_DESC
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that identifies whether the entity was at fault base on the attending police officer will assessment of the crash. This indicator indicates the officer’s decision, regardless of the ensuing legal and/or insurance results.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: PRE_ACTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the action of each vehicle immediately prior to first contact.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: PRE_ACTION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the action of each vehicle immediately prior to first contact.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: STOLEN_VEHICLE
resources.schema.fields.description: Indicates whether the vehicle was stolen.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: THIRD_TYPE_OF_COLLISION
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the type of impact, after the primary crash occurrence (diagram), when there is more than one injury or damage producing event in the crash. It is possible that one vehicle will have a third event while the other vehicle involved in the crash does not.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: THIRD_TYPE_OF_COLLISION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes that type of impact, after the primary crash occurrence (diagram), when there is more than one injury or damage producing event in the crash. It is possible that one vehicle will have a third event while the other vehicle involved in the crash does not.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: TOW_INDICATOR
resources.schema.fields.description: Indicates whether the vehicle was towed from the crash, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: TRAVEL_DIRECTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The alphabetic letter that describes the direction of travel of the vehicle or if the vehicle was parked.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: TRAVEL_DIRECTION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the direction of travel or parked vehicle.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: VEHICLE_JURISDICTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The originating jurisdiction of the vehicle licence plate, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY

resources.schema.fields.description: The vehicle make as shown on registration documents, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: VEHICLE_STYLE
resources.schema.fields.description: The vehicle body style as shown on registration documents, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: VEHICLE_TYPE
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the type of vehicle involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: VEHICLE_TYPE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the type of vehicle involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: VEHICLE_USE
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the vehicle use at the time of the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: VEHICLE_USE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the vehicle's use at the time of the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: VEHICLE_YEAR
resources.schema.fields.description: The vehicle model year as shown on registration documents.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: AGE_RANGE
resources.schema.fields.description:
The age of the individual involved at the time of the crash, categorized by:
00-03
04-07
08-12
13-15
16-18
19-21
22-25
26-35 
36-45
46-55
56-65
66-75
76-85
86+
Unknown

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: ENTITY_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: The classification assigned to an entity used to categorize the type of entity.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: GENDER
resources.schema.fields.description: The alphabetic letter that describes gender of the entity involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: INJURY_CLASS
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the extent of the injuries.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: INJURY_CLASS_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the extent of the injuries.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: INJURY_LOCATION
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes location of the most severe, obvious injury.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: INJURY_LOCATION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes location of the most severe, obvious injury.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: INJURY_TYPE
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the physical injury sustained. If the victim suffers multiple injuries, the most severe type of injury is recorded.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: INJURY_TYPE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the physical injury sustained. If the victim suffers multiple injuries, the most severe type of injury is recorded.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: OCCUPANT_EJECTED_INDICATOR
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that identifies whether the vehicle occupant was ejected or partially ejected from vehicle.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: OCCUPANT_EJECTED_INDICATOR_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that identifies whether the vehicle occupant was ejected or partially ejected from vehicle.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: PASSENGER_POSITION
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the position of drivers and passengers in/on vehicle or bicycle.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: PASSENGER_POSITION_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the position of drivers and passengers in/on vehicle or bicycle.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: POSITION_SEQUENCE
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric sequence (in relation to the victim's position) in cases where two people were in the same passenger position. For example, more than one person in cargo area.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: POSITION_SEQUENCE_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the position of drivers and passengers in/on vehicle or bicycle.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: SAFETY_EQUIPMENT
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the type of safety equipment used by the persons involved.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: SAFETY_EQUIPMENT_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the type of safety equipment used by the persons involved.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: TAKEN_BY
resources.schema.fields.description: The abbreviated description of the injured person’s mode of transportation away from the crash.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: TAKEN_BY_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description of the injured person’s mode of transportation away from the crash.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: TAKEN_TO
resources.schema.fields.description: The abbreviated description of the location the injured person's was taken to.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: TAKEN_TO_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description of the location the injured person's was taken to.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: VICTIM_STATUS
resources.schema.fields.description: The numeric code that describes the overall condition of the injured person. This field is used to identify if the victim was deceased.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: VICTIM_STATUS_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The text description that describes the overall condition of the injured person. This field is used to identify if the victim was deceased.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: Unique identifier of a collision report.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: The house, building, or lot number contained within the block or street address at which the entity was situated at the time of the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: STREET_NAME
resources.schema.fields.description: The name of the street, thoroughfare or road infrastructure component where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACC_STREET_FULL_NAME
resources.schema.fields.description: The full name and type of the road infrastructure component where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: CROSS_STREET_NAME
resources.schema.fields.description: The name of the nearest cross-street, thoroughfare or road infrastructure component where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACC_CROSS_STREET_FULL_NAME
resources.schema.fields.description: The full name and type of the nearest cross-street, thoroughfare or road infrastructure component where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LKI_HWY_KM_OFFSET_DIST
resources.schema.fields.description: The highway portion of the Location Code (LKI). The route or highway number as defined by the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MoTI).

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LKI_HWY_ROUTE_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description:
The highway portion of the Location Code (LKI). The route or highway number as defined by the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MoTI).

The LKI is comprised of three data entry fields which are a location on BC provincial highways in reference to a defined Inventory of Landmarks:
• Route
• Segment
• Offset

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LKI_HWY_SEGMENT_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description:
The highway portion of the Location Code (LKI). The route or highway number as defined by the Ministry of Transportation and Infrastructure (MoTI).

The LKI is comprised of three data entry fields which are a location on BC provincial highways in reference to a defined Inventory of Landmarks:
• Route
• Segment
• Offset

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACC_ROAD_LOCATION_DESCRIPTION
resources.schema.fields.description: The full address or street name and cross street where the crash occurred.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: Unique identifier of a collision report.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: DRIVER_LICENSE_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: The driver’s licence number for the entity involved in the crash, if available.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: NAME
resources.schema.fields.description: The last and first name of the entity, separated by a comma.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: PLATE_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: The vehicle license plate of vehicle entity.

resources.name: TAS_ENTITY
resources.schema.fields.name: VEHICLE_REGISTRATION_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: The vehicle registration number as shown on registration documents, if applicable.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_NUMBER
resources.schema.fields.description: Unique identifier of a collision report.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: AGE
resources.schema.fields.description: The age of the individual involved at the time of the crash. Newborn to two years of age are recorded as one year of age.

resources.name: TAS_VICTIM
resources.schema.fields.name: VICTIM_NAME
resources.schema.fields.description: The last and first name of the victim, separated by a comma.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: SNAPSHOT_DATE
resources.schema.fields.description: The date the data was captured.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: ACCIDENT_DATE
resources.schema.fields.description: Date of crash. (e.g., 1/31/2019)

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LATITUDE
resources.schema.fields.description: The geographic coordinate that specifies the east - west position of the crash location.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: LONGITUDE
resources.schema.fields.description: The geographic coordinate that specifies the north–south position of the crash location.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: TOTAL_VEHICLES_INVOLVED
resources.schema.fields.description: The count of vehicles, including bicycles, involved in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: TOTAL_INJURED
resources.schema.fields.description: The count of people injured in the crash.

resources.name: TAS_ACCIDENT
resources.schema.fields.name: TOTAL_KILLED
resources.schema.fields.description: The count of people killed in the crash. Fatal victim refers to a road user who died within 30 days after the date when an injury was sustained in the crash involving at least one motor vehicle.
